name: Anthony Masi
summary:
Anthony is a security engineer based in the Washington, D.C. metro area. Currently he is a part of Facebook's Investigations & Response team where he blends incident response with operational threat intelligence.

His interests include finance, geopolitics, software engineering, threat tracking, and offensive security.

responsibilities: Conducted technical threat surface analyses, highlighting potential attacker tactics, techniques and procedures (TTPs), gaps in collected signal, and detection ideas
Collaborated tightly with customer and stakeholder teams in determining the highest priority threats to a technical surface and roadmaps to improvement
Wrote tests to emulate attacker procedures in order to validate internal detection mechanisms
Acted as a threat intelligence lead for cross-functional project work across the company
Tracked advanced persistent threat (APT) actors, pivoting on and enriching datasets to discover new on-platform accounts and off-platform adversary infrastructure
Investigated security alerts related to APT actors as part of an oncall rotation
Hunted for threat actor activity based on self-generated and vendor supplied threat intelligence
Developed internal tools in Hacklang and React
Developed and deployed a malware analysis network to support sponsor operations
Developed a parser for iOS to retrieve and analyze public and private frameworks for forensic analysis
Developed a STIX/TAXII server to parse and distribute cyber threat intelligence information
Led and conducted a research study and behavioral analysis of ransomware and its effect on consumers
Developed Python-based parsers to perform postmortem analysis on victim filesystems
Reverse engineered samples to determine encryption algorithms and command & control servers

awards.name: 1st Place in Kaspersky Lab's Cyber Security Case Study Competition
